results.title: The Awful truth
results.brief_description: One of the classic screwball comedies of the 1930s, “The Awful truth” was nominated for six Academy Awards, winning an Oscar for director Leo McCarey. This was the third time the story had been brought to the screen, this version particularly working because of the improvisation encouraged of the cast and crew. The actors’ state of bewilderment and the humour born from this is reinforced by the fact that much of their dialogue is ad-libbed. The story centres around New York couple the Warriners (Cary Grant and Irene Dunne), who both suspect the infidelities of the other. They agree to a trial divorce, but cannot agree on who will get custody of their pet dog Mr Smith. What follows is a battlefield of witty dialogue, slapstick, sophisticated New York versus Southern manners and sublime bickering, while the Warriners attempt to sabotage each other’s new romances and ultimately try to reunite.

results.title: The Awakening bell
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changing Australia”.
Amongst the Vietnamese community in Australia there are often unresolved tensions between those who left Vietnam before 1975 and the boat people who left after 1975. In 1987 Buddhist priest and Nobel Peace Prize nominee, Thich Nhat Hanh, accompanied by his co-worker, Cao Ngoc Phuong, a Buddhist nun, visited Australia in an attempt to reconcile some of those differences and to teach those who suffered how to free themselves from painful memories. This moving documentary, focuses on this impressive pair and their philosophy which teaches that one must have peace within oneself in order to achieve peace in the world, so that meditation becomes a drastic peace action.

results.title: The Awakening
results.creator_credit: Millbank Films, Lloyds Bank, Peter Griffiths and Ron Tanner
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Starting your own business”.
This is the second film in the series, Starting Your Own Business. The film continues the story of the three people who are self-employed, and it traces the first year in business for each of the characters. Again the problems and pitfalls involved in going it alone are identified and the audience can see the reasons why two of the businesses fail.

results.title: The Awaited Messiah
results.creator_credit: Don Bosco Multimedia, Vincenzo Labella and Franco Zeffirelli
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Jesus of Nazareth”.
This is the beginning of the story of the life of Jesus Christ, from the betrothal of Mary and Joseph; the Angel visits Mary; the wedding of Mary and Joseph and the unrest of young zealots.

results.title: The Aviators of Hudson Strait
results.brief_description: A look at early Canadian aviation, through film footage shot by the Royal Canadian Air Force and the recollections of retired Air Vice-Marshal Thomas A. Lawrence, leader of the 1927-28 aerial survey expedition to Ungava Bay and Hudson Strait. The formidable challenge of flying under Arctic conditions, the hazards faced and the emergencies solved, often with the help of Inuit, make an absorbing chapter of northern frontier history. Written by William Weintraub.

results.title: The Aviator's wife = La Femme de l'Aviateur ou On ne saurait penser a rien = One can't think of nothing
results.creator_credit: Les Films du Losange, Margaret Menegoz and Eric Rohmer
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Comedies et proverbes”.
The first of Eric Rohmer’s six “Comedies et proverbes” hinges on the activities of four central characters who mislead, misunderstand and finally miss out. A delightful comedy of errors, spiced with Rohmer’s portrayal and obvious understanding of the pain which can result from poor human communication.

results.title: The Average chap
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Lie with Statistics”.
The second in a series of animated cartoons based on the book by Darrell Huff and Irving Geis about statistical trickery. Concentrates on the use and misuse of averages. Intended for management training, colleges and schools. Narration by John Cleese. Animation by Tony Hart.

results.title: The Avengers. Vol. 01
results.brief_description: They were sauve, sophisticated and dangerous. Patrick Macnee and Diana Rigg, as Steed and Emma Peel delighted audiences worldwide in the sixties espionage thriller “The Avengers.” Two episodes are featured. “The Town of no return” shot in black and white in 1965, sees four agents disappear from a small remote village on the Norfolk coast and Steed and Peel are called upon to solve the case. “From Venus with love”, shot in colour in 1966, sees Steed and Peel in their own version of the “X-files” as astronomers are dying with their hair bleached white by an unknown killer.

results.title: The Avengers
results.brief_description: Espionage, fantasy and a healthy dose of unresolved sexual tension abound in this slick series that has proved to be one of the most successful television series of all time. Originally aired in the UK between January 1961 and September 1969 and comprising of 161 episodes, the series went on to screen in a record number of 120 countries. John Steed (Patrick McNee) was always an Avenger, appearing in all episodes - Mrs Peel (Diana Rigg) was his third and most enduring partner. The series was resurrected in the mid 1970s, episodes of which are also available in the collection.
